page.title: 16THE RAILWAY & IRON BRIDGE
page.content: A railway used to run through Bishopthorpe Village, and there was a level crossing on Copmanthorpe Lane. The track has now been pulled up and a cycle path is being laid. The{IRON BRIDGE }is a railway bridge over the River Ouse to the south of Bishopthorpe. It was first used in 1871 when the line from York to Selby and Doncaster was opened as part of the East Coast main line from London to Edinburgh. It was last used in 1983 when the main line was diverted by Colton Junction to avoid the new Selby Coalfield. It is 80m long and 7.1 m wide. It has a moveable section 37 m long to allow large ships to travel to and from York.
